PROVING THE EXISTENCE OF A WILL
A will which was, by accident or by the act of a third party, destroyed, lost, hidden or misplaced, either after the testator's death or prior to it, but without his or her knowledge, shall in effect be a valid will, provided the wronged party can prove that a will existed and was destroyed, lost, hidden or misplaced, as well as that it was drawn up in the form determined by an Act, and the same party also proves the content of the part of the will he or she is referring to.
